text: His wit’s as thick as a Tewkesbury mustard.
I am pigeon-liver’d and lack gall.
column4: or our indepth analysis of ‘To be or not to be’

text: I am sick when I do look on thee
I must tell you friendly in your ear
severity: you are not for all markets.

origin: marry a fool; for wise men know well enough what monsters you make of them.
but I would infect my hands.

text: Methink’st thou art a general offence and every man should beat thee.
More of your conversation would infect my brain.
The rankest compound of villainous smell that ever offended nostril
The tartness of his face sours ripe grapes.
There’s no more faith in thee than in a stewed prune.

severity: is to speak well of thine friend; thine backward voice is to utter foul speeches and to detract.

column6: that roasted Manningtree ox with pudding in his belly

text: Thine face is not worth sunburning.

severity: she goes off and on at pleasure.

text: Thou art as fat as butter.
Like the toad; ugly and venomous.
Thou art unfit for any place but hell.
Thou damned and luxurious mountain goat.
Thou sodden-witted lord! Thou hast no more brain than I have in mine elbows
Thy tongue outvenoms all the worms of Nile.
Would thou wert clean enough to spit upon
You scullion! You rampallian! You fustilarian! I’ll tickle your catastrophe!

column5: you stock-fish-O for breath to utter what is like thee!-you tailor’s-yard

text: Your brain is as dry as the remainder biscuit after voyage.
